subject: AI & Agents
title: AlphaGo's Move 37
description: A quick, practical guide to AlphaGo's Move 37.

hook.text: Game 2, Move 37. The AI places a stone where no professional would. Commentators gasp. It's brilliant.

buildup.text: AlphaGo faced Lee Sedol, one of the greatest Go players in history, in a five-game match.

discovery.text: Move 37 was a shoulder hit on the fifth line â€” a move with a 1 in 10,000 probability by human standards.

twist.text: Fan Hui, the European champion, was commentating and said his hands were shaking watching it.

climax.text: The move turned the game. AlphaGo won the match 4-1 and changed how humans play Go forever.

punchline.text: One impossible move. A new chapter in human-machine history.

quiz.question: Why was AlphaGo's Move 37 so significant?
options: It was a move no human professional would play, yet it was brilliant
It was the fastest move in Go history
It was a copying of a famous historical game
